sen.j: 学校法人同志社（がっこうほうじんどうししゃ、英字表記The Doshisha）は、同志社大学や同志社女子大学が属する学校法人。
sen.e: The Doshisha is an educational institution, which includes Doshisha University and Doshisha Women's College of Liberal Arts.
The Doshisha is an educational institution, which includes Doshisha University and Doshisha Women's College of Liberal Arts.
The Doshisha is an educational institution, which includes Doshisha University and Doshisha Women's College of Liberal Arts.

sen.j: 同志社は1875年、新島襄によって創立されたキリスト教プロテスタント（会衆派）に基づくキリスト教主義の学校で、大学から幼稚園まで「同志社」の名を冠する9つの教育機関を有する総合学園である（2005年4月現在）。
sen.e: The Doshisha was founded by Joseph Hardy Neesima (Jo NIIJIMA) in 1875, and as of April, 2005, it has 9 educational institutions from kindergarten to university, and all of them were named after "Doshisha". Christianity is its foundation stone, and these institutions are based on Protestantism (Congregationalism).

Founded by Joseph Hardy Neesima (Jo NIIJIMA) in 1875, the Doshisha had nine educational institutions as of April 2005, ranging from kindergarten to university, all of which use the name "Doshisha." These are Christian institutions that are run based on the principles of Protestantism (Congregationalism).
sen.cmt: Quite a lot of work was required to make this read more naturally. To begin with it is usually best to avoid starting two consecutive sentences with the same subject (i.e. "The Doshisha"). Also, if you say "as of" with a date that is clearly in the past, the past tense should be used.
sen.e: Founded by Joseph Hardy Neesima (Jo NIIJIMA) in 1875, the Doshisha had nine educational institutions as of April 2005, ranging from kindergarten to university, all of which use the name "Doshisha." These are Christian institutions that are run based on the principles of Protestantism (Congregationalism).

sen.j: 2004年4月現在でおおよそ36000人が同志社で学んでいる。
sen.e: About 36000 students are studying in the Doshisha as of April, 2004.
Approximately 36,000 students were studying at the Doshisha as of April 2004.
sen.cmt: Again, if you say "as of" with a date that is clearly in the past, the past tense should be used. No comma is required between a month and a year.
sen.e: Approximately 36,000 students were studying at the Doshisha as of April 2004.

sen.j: 現在、学校法人同志社は、株式会社格付投資情報センター (R＆I) から、<AA+>を取得している。
sen.e: Now Rating and Investment Information, Inc. (R&I) gave the Doshisha <AA+>.
sen.cmt: http://www.r-i.co.jp/ 1文が2つのセルにわかれていたため、統合
sen.e: At present, Rating and Investment Information, Inc. (R&I) rates the Doshisha at <AA+>.
sen.cmt: If you use "now" at the beginning of a sentence like this (i.e. without a comma), it's difficult to know whether it forms part of the name of the company or just means at present. Anyway, in this case "at present" reads more naturally, I think. Also, if you do use "now" (or another word of the same meaning), you should generally use the present simple or continuous.
sen.e: At present, Rating and Investment Information, Inc. (R&I) rates the Doshisha at <AA+>.

sen.j: <AA+>は、21段階ある格付けの上から2番目。
sen.e: <AA+> is the second best rating out of 21ratings.
sen.cmt: 2文が1つのセルに入っていたため分解
sen.e: <AA+> is the second-highest rating out of 21 ratings.

sen.j: 学校法人早稲田大学、学校法人慶應義塾と並んで、学校法人としてはトップである。
sen.e: It is the best rating among the educational institutions, along with Waseda University and Keio University.
sen.cmt: 2文が1つのセルに入っていたため分解

sen.j: 同志社の建学精神はキリスト教精神に基づく「良心」である。
sen.e: The Doshisha was founded on the sprit of "conscience" based on Christian spirit.
sen.cmt: 以下、建学の精神における「」内の語句の翻訳出典は全て、http://www.doshisha.ac.jp/english/information/overview/pdf/brochure.pdf
sen.e: The Doshisha was founded on the sprit of "conscience," based on the spirit of Christianity.
The Doshisha was founded on the sprit of "conscience," based on the spirit of Christianity.

sen.j: 新島襄は建学の目的として、「良心を手腕に運用する人物」の育成を掲げた。
sen.e: Joseph Hardy Neesima defined a goal of nurturing "those who use their abilities as conscience dictates."
Joseph Hardy Neesima defined a goal of nurturing "those who use their abilities as conscience dictates."
Joseph Hardy Neesima defined a goal of nurturing "those who use their abilities as conscience dictates."

sen.j: 知識教育に偏ることのないよう、キリスト教に基づく「徳育」を並行して進めることで、「良心の全身に充満」した人々を輩出したいと願ったのである。
sen.e: He desired to send out "graduates filled with conscience" into the world, providing an education based on Christian values to foster those who are well balanced.
He wanted to send "graduates filled with conscience" into the world by providing an education based on Christian values and thereby fostering well-balanced individuals.
He wanted to send "graduates filled with conscience" into the world by providing an education based on Christian values and thereby fostering well-balanced individuals.

sen.j: その思いを彼の筆跡のまま刻んだ碑が、同志社大学などの諸学校に存在する。
sen.e: Some memorial monuments on which his ideal of education was inscribed in his own handwriting are placed at several educational institutions such as Doshisha University.
Some memorial monuments on which his ideal of education has been inscribed in his own handwriting are housed at several educational institutions, such as Doshisha University.
Some memorial monuments on which his ideal of education has been inscribed in his own handwriting are housed at several educational institutions, such as Doshisha University.

sen.j: この良心碑には、「良心之全身ニ充満シタル丈夫ノ起リ来ラン事ヲ」という言葉が刻まれている。
sen.e: On these monuments, you can see the words as follows: "I earnestly desire that many young people filled with conscience will be raised and sent out by our school."
On these monuments one can see the following words: "I earnestly desire that many young people filled with conscience will be raised and sent out by our school."
On these monuments one can see the following words: "I earnestly desire that many young people filled with conscience will be raised and sent out by our school."

sen.j: また、この「良心」教育を具体的に実現するための教育理念として、「キリスト教主義」「自由主義」「国際主義」が掲げられ、これらを通じて「一国の良心」たる人物を輩出することを目指している。
sen.e: Also, the Doshisha set fundamental educational ideals of "Christian principles", "liberalism" and "internationalism" to achieve the "conscience" education. Through these ideals, the Doshisha seeks to send out those who are "the nation's conscience."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Additionally, the Doshisha established the fundamental educational ideals of "Christian principles," "liberalism" and "internationalism" in order to achieve the education of "conscience"; through these ideals the Doshisha seeks to send forth those who are "the nation's conscience."

Additionally, the Doshisha established the fundamental educational ideals of "Christian principles," "liberalism" and "internationalism" in order to achieve the education of "conscience"; through these ideals the Doshisha seeks to send forth those who are "the nation's conscience."

sen.j: キリスト教プロテスタント系の学校法人で、会衆派教会（組合教会）の流れをくむ。

sen.j: しかし、いわゆるミッション系大学とは性質が異なり、キリスト教伝道を主たる目的としない（教育そのものを伝道の手段としない）。
sen.e: However, it is different from other Christian universities in that it doesn't seek to preach Christianity as a main goal of education.

sen.e: The survived framework of Yushukan was to be removed, but Goichi TAKEDA, a constructor of Doshisha Girls' School, recommended repairing and preserving the building. Yushukan was finally preserved by making reinforced concrete walls (wall thickness: 15cm) at inner side of the outside walls.

sen.cmt: The order is correct as information in an address is presented in the opposite order in English to that used in Japanese. However, it's best to avoid leaving some parts of the address in Japanese (e.g. "ku"), other parts with the Japanese and English (e.g. "...-dori Street"), and other parts in English only (e.g. "City"). For addresses, the following would be best in my opinion:

sen.e: In the last days of the Tokugawa shogunate, there was a residence of the lord of the Satsuma Domain in the present Imadegawa Campus of Doshisha University.

sen.j: 1862年に京都市中京区から移転し、倒幕運動の拠点となった。
sen.e: The residence was relocated from Nakagyo-ku, Kyoto City in 1862, and used as a meeting place for those who attempted to overthrow the shogunate.

sen.j: 同志社大学新町校地の臨光館一帯は摂家の一つで公家の近衛家の邸宅があった。
sen.e: There was a residence of the Konoe family, a court noble (Kuge) and one of the regent families (Sekke), around Rinkokan in Shinmachi campus of Doshisha University.
There was a residence of the Konoe family, a court noble (Kuge) and one of the regent families (Sekke) in the vicinity of Rinkokan, on the Shinmachi campus of Doshisha University.

sen.e: The part of the residence is still conserved in the basement of Rinkokan today.

sen.j: 石敷き遺構 (同志社大学室町校地)
sen.e: Stone-paved historical site (Doshisha University, Muromachi Campus)
Stone-paved historical site (Doshisha University, Muromachi Campus)
Stone-paved historical site (Doshisha University, Muromachi Campus)

sen.j: 2002年の同志社大学室町校地寒梅館の建設に伴う発掘調査にて発見された。
sen.e: It was found during the excavations carried out before Kambaikan in Muromachi Campus was constructed in 2002.
It was found during the excavations that were performed prior to the construction of Kambaikan, on the Muromachi Campus, in 2002.
It was found during the excavations that were performed prior to the construction of Kambaikan, on the Muromachi Campus, in 2002.

sen.j: 石敷きの中から16世紀中頃の土器が出土した。
sen.e: Some earthenware made in about 16th century was found out from the stone-paved site.
Some earthenware dating from about the sixteenth century was found within the stone-paved site.
Some earthenware dating from about the sixteenth century was found within the stone-paved site.

sen.j: 洛中洛外図により、寒梅館周辺は第12代将軍足利義晴が再築した室町殿のあった場所と推定される。
sen.e: According to the Views In and Around Kyoto (Rakuchu rakugai zu), the place around Kambaikan was considered to have been a site of the Muromachi estate (Muromachi dono), which the 12th shogun Yoshiharu Ashikaga had reconstructed. Being identified as the site drawn in the Views In and Around Kyoto, the stone-paved site seems to be a part of a shrine located in the northeast of the Muromachi estate and a foundation of the reclaimed land in the south of the shrine.

According to "Views in and Around Kyoto (Rakuchu rakugai zu)," the place around Kambaikan was considered to have been a site of the Muromachi estate (Muromachi dono), which the twelfth shogun Yoshiharu Ashikaga had reconstructed. Being identified as the site drawn in "Views in and Around Kyoto," the stone-paved site seems to be a part of a shrine located in the northeast of the Muromachi estate and a foundation of the reclaimed land in the south of the shrine.

According to "Views in and Around Kyoto (Rakuchu rakugai zu)", the area around Kambaikan was considered to have been the site of the Muromachi estate (Muromachi dono), which the twelfth shogun Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA had reconstructed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 出土したものと、洛中洛外図が一致するため、この石敷きは室町殿の北東隅の社とその南の築地基礎と推定される。
sen.e: Identified as being the site that was portrayed in "Views in and Around Kyoto," the stone-paved site seems to be a part of a shrine located in the northeast section of the Muromachi estate and a foundation of the reclaimed land in the southern section of the shrine.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 現在は寒梅館にて一部発掘したままの状態を見ることができるようになっている。
sen.e: Now you can see a part of the stone-paved site in its original condition at Kambaikan.
Today one can see a part of the stone-paved site in its original condition at Kambaikan.
Today one can see a part of the stone-paved site in its original condition at Kambaikan.

sen.j: 恐竜の足跡 (同志社大学今出川校地)
sen.e: Dinosaur track fossil (Doshisha University, Imadegawa Campus)
Dinosaur track fossil (Doshisha University, Imadegawa Campus)
Dinosaur track fossil (Doshisha University, Imadegawa Campus)

sen.j: アーモスト館とゲストハウスの渡り廊下に恐竜の足跡がある。
sen.e: There is a dinosaur track fossil at a breezeway between Amherst House and a guest house.
There is a fossilized dinosaur footprint located in a breezeway between Amherst House and a guest house.
There is a fossilized dinosaur footprint located in a breezeway between Amherst House and a guest house.

sen.j: この足跡は、アメリカ合衆国のニューイングランド、コネチカット州の渓谷から出たもので「時の砂に押し残された足跡」と記されている。
sen.e: This track was came from the Connecticut Valley in the U.S., and there is a inscription on the fossil as follows: "footprints left in the sand of time."
This fossil came from the Connecticut Valley in the U.S., and the fossil carries the following inscription: "footprints left in the sands of time."
This footprint came from the Connecticut Valley in the U.S., and the fossil carries the following inscription: "footprints left in the sands of time."

sen.j: 有史前の足跡は「新世界」からアジアの「旧世界」へと同志社とアーモスト、アメリカ合衆国と日本の長い絆を想起させるものとして贈られてきたものである。
sen.e: It was sent from "the New World" to "the Old World" for recalling the bond between the Doshisha and Amherst, Japan and the U.S.
It was sent from "the New World" to "the Old World" to commemorate the bond between the Doshisha and Amherst, and between Japan and the U.S.
It was sent from "the New World" to "the Old World" to commemorate the long-standing bond between the Doshisha and Amherst, and between Japan and the U.S.
sen.cmt: I think "commemorate" is more in keeping with the nuance of the Japanese. Also, the 「長い] part of 「長い絆」 seems to have been left untranslated. Consequently, I think this would be best.
